body.name: LabelCreate T02 Inkless Sticker Printer, Mini Thermal Printer with 3 Rolls Paper, Portable Bluetooth Pocket Sticker Printer Machine for Kids,Study,DIY
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 15 hrs 37 mins
features: 🎄【203dpi Clear Printing】T02 Inkless Sticker Printer is designed with a cute and compact design, perfect for children's preferences. With a clarity of 203 dpi, it delivers excellent printing results. Children can unleash their creativity and print various patterns they love with ease.

🎄【Freely edited Sticker Printer Machine】The T02 Sticker Printer comes with three rolls of 50mm-53mm thermal paper, providing you with ample printing material. Say goodbye to the hassle of replacing roll paper frequently!Save time and reduce costs with the T02 Pocket Printer. No more wasted paper or unnecessary trips to restock supplies. Let your imagination run wild and bring your ideas to life with this innovative printing solution.

🎄【Simple Operation Pocket Sticker Printer】① Connect Bluetooth Easily via the App. ② Resolve "No Paper" Alert: Remove paper roll, long press power button for 10 seconds until green light flashes twice, then reinsert paper for normal printing. ③ Prevent Content Shifting with Paper Holder.

🎄【Inkless Required】Say goodbye to the hassle of constantly replacing ink cartridges and enjoy the convenience of inkless printing. The LabelCreate T02 inkless sticker printer uses heat to create high-quality prints, resulting in sharp and vibrant images, text, and graphics.

🎄【Use Occasions】Print stunning black and white photos, memos, and records with the LabelCreate T02 Inkless Sticker Printer. With its wireless capabilities, you can conveniently print from anywhere in your home, school, or office. Let your imagination run wild as you bring to life various patterns and themes that children love. ❗Tips：Avoid exposing thermal paper to sunlight or high temperatures (temperature over 40 degrees)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wish I’d bought this years ago!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I’m a college student and will be taking science-heavy courses. I wanted a cleaner way to print various figures, tables, or formulas. I have only tried using it for typing in these formulas, but I printed a picture of my daughter for fun, and it came out grainy, but otherwise great! I got this on sale, but it was well worth the price I would’ve paid otherwise just to save me from frustration of accidentally messing up hand-drawing things for my notes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: The printer is light weight and prints fast. The software and the graphics are not the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was delivered fast without problems. It works great my kids love it, it was a huge help during finals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's ok if you have the right use for it
reviews.reviewText: I'm trying to think of someone who would really appreciate this and the only thing I can come up with is a scrapbooker, or just someone who really loves stickers.Pros:-Fairly easy to operate through the app, lots of little templates and options-Prints quickly, decent print quality (great for text, kind of a grainy/newspaper black and white for images)Cons:-I can't evenly tear the paper, especially the smaller the print! I printed some pics of my pup's faces (adorable), and those were a little easier to tear, although I crinkled both in the process. Then I wanted to print some labels for some folders, but every single one was un-useable because they ripped in half while I was trying my best to tear them cleanly. I had my partner try to see if it was just me, but he also wasted a bunch of the paper trying.-My first order came without any sample paper. A bummer, but Amazon sent some. It's a small sample roll and will need to be used sparingly to last. Replacement rolls run around $4 a roll.Overall, I was between 3 and 4 stars, but because I can't use it for the primary use of label creating I wanted to, and I can't think of anyone I would personally recommend this to, I settled on 3 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A crafter's little best friend
reviews.reviewText: I am a d-i-yer and I absolutely love this mini printer. I wasn't sure how well it would work when I ordered but I was excited to give it a try. The app that you use in partnership with this printer is pretty user friendly and has a lot of images for you to choose from. It does an ok job with printing pictures and it works for what I have planned for it. I can take it with me anywhere and print small stickers on the go. I love it for myself and I think that any crafter or scrapbooker would also love this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This thing is pretty great at what it does, and I've enjoyed using it.I use it for a bunch, be it just standard label making, printing off small pictures for the front of categorized folders, and even keeping my kids entertained. I can't pretend I haven't gotten enough use out of it to make it well worth the time and effort figuring it out.The print quality is good. Everything comes out looking nice in an acceptable resolution. The adhesive works well on the paper this takes also.This thing is also sturdy. It's fallen off of the counter into hard tile three times now and I haven't noticed any damage at all.Closer to a 5 than a 4.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars LabelCreat T02 Sticker Printer = Phomemo T02 Mini Printer
reviews.reviewText: The box and quickstart guide is labeled "Phomemo Mini Printer" with the product model "T02."I like mini thermal printers because I think it is neat to take/print/stick pictures into my notes and other items. I already have another mini thermal printer (Nameer Label Makers Mini Portable Small Printer) but had trouble finding compatible paper/sticker paper and needed to do alot of adjustments to use other company's paper in that printer. I got this mini printer (LabelCreate T02 Sticker Printer -> which is really the Phomemom T02 Mini Printer) since it seemed to be easier to find compatible T02 paper and had an inner spool (labeled "adjuster" in the manual) to help line up the paper.Thoughts:- cute little size- easy to turn on- no need to buy ink refills- thermal printers are like the old fax paper printers we used to have -- They can only print in black/gray/white. The ink is heat sensitive, and can fade and become hard to read and scan over time. Thermal labels are sensitive to abrasions and exposure to water, chemicals, and strong sunlight. For these reasons, direct thermal printing is not the best choice for long-term use.USE:- download the app "Phomemo" and then connect to bluetooth and pair with "T02"- software a little clunky and slow- limited templates (greeting cards, fun, to-do list, frame, schedule, business card)- there is no template for labels- when you go to "Print Images", you are able to search your gallery on your phone to select an image, then edit (crop, rotate, filter, adjust) and print it out- this is better than the Nameer printer because it has an inner spool that you put inside the roll of sticker paper to keep the paper loaded correctly and not shift while printing. The other printer (Nameer) tended to have the sides of the paper/sticker paper get stuck and caused curling/crease folds on the side once printed out).- Read the manual carefully to figure out how to replace the printing paper and insert the spool/adjuster in the correct orientation- Only came with one sample roll of sticker paper (adhesive thermal paper)- But there are plenty of places to buy compatible paper for the T02 printer (paper equal to or less than 55 mm wide). Search for "Phomemo Printer Paper" or "Self-Adhesive Mini Printer Paper for M02/M02 Pro/M02S/M03M03AS/M04S Mini Pocket Printer." The paper should be equal to or less than 55 mm wide.Compared to my other thermal printer (Nameer brand), I like this Phomemo Printer more due to the better alignment and compatibility with more types of paper. However, it is mainly used for stickers and probably would not work as well for making labels (especially since it doesn't have label templates (like my Nameer brand does).

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful Bluetooth based thermal sticker printer!
reviews.reviewText: Connects to your iPhone or cellphone via bluetooth easy to pair and setup. Nice pre-made templates but in the end, the kids went nuts in "stickerizing" funky photos that they wanted to immortalize - mainly photos that you don't want to be reminded of.. lol5/5 Stars!

This little printer can fit in your pocket. It is so cute and makes a great gift! It comes packaged in a nice retail style box.What I like about it?-Comes with a sample roll of sticker paper-does not need ink (uses thermal technology on thermal paper/stickers-works completely wirelessly via bluetooth through your phone or tablet-very simple to open and close to load the roll of paper (which is available very easily to buy more)-works with a great app that has lots of templates and is very intuitive-includes USB type C charging cable and holds a long charge. You can print on the go, in your car, literally anywhere with nothing plugged in, straight from your phone!-The build quality is excellent and just what I would expect if spending twice this amount at the local big box store.What I dont like?-The roll of paper that it comes with is not that long. Its more of a sample roll, but more than enough to get started and print a bunch of stickers.-black and white only (the nature of all inkless thermal printers) however you can get coloured thermal paper of all kinds including transparent for very affordable on Amazon.Overall I like having this little printer, and a few others that are similar to it. I notice that they take quite standard sizes of thermal paper rolls. I think this is also an inexpensive way to introduce a young child to the joys of scrapbooking, or label making, or just learning to use printing technology in general - and you wont find it at this price anywhere locally. Only on Amazon have I seen these printers for this great price.

Bought this for journaling purposes but the printing quality does not last. Ink rubs off on basically anything, so then I tried to use clear, transparent tape to protect the ink to no avail. Easy to use, though.
This works great and is fun.
